info.name: Tarling
info.description: Tarling familiar from Heliana's Guide to Monster Hunting

description.p: Armor Class 13 (natural armour)
Hit Points 4 (1d4 + 2)
Speed 30 ft., swim 30 ft.
Damage Resistances acid, piercing, poison
Senses darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 10
Languages —

Flammable. If the tarling takes fire damage, it ignites. It and any creature it is grappling take 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of its turns and its weapon attacks deal an additional 2 (1d4) fire damage on a hit. If the tarling is subject to heavy rainfall or it takes 5 or more cold damage in a single instance, the flames are extinguished.

Oil Form. When the tarling tries to move through water, it instead uses its swimming speed to skim along the water’s surface; it can’t submerge below the surface of water without a powerful detergent.

Bite.
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

description.p: Whenever you gain a level beyond 1st in this class, each companion to which you are bonded gains one of the following improvements. Any newly gained companions receive these additional Hit Dice and improvements as if you had them since your 1st level in tamer.

sheet.description: The Tarling has the following Improvements:

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)

The tarling’s size increases to Small, its Hit Die size increases to a d6 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage die of its bite attack increases to a d6. The tarling gains this improvement when it becomes a companion; it doesn’t cost an improvement.

sheet.description: Size: Small. Hit Die: d6. Bite damage: d6.

description.p: Type: Active (bonus action)

As a bonus action, the tarling can activate its arcane power source for 1 minute. For the duration, the tarling has resistance to necrotic damage and deals an additional 3 (1d6) necrotic damage when it hits a target with a melee attack.
After the tarling uses this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a long rest.

sheet.description: Resistance to necrotic damage and +1d6 necrotic damage with melee attacks (1 min).

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)

The tarling’s size increases to Medium, its Hit Die size increases to a d8 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage dice of its bite and tail attacks (see below), as well as its Arcane Activation, increase from a d6 to a d8. This growth improvement ignores the normal maximum companion size for a tamer.

sheet.description: Size: Medium. Hit Die: d8. Bite/Tail/Arcane Activation damage: d8.

description.p: Type: Active (action)
As an action, the tarling makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

sheet.description: Two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

description.p: Type: Active (action)
Melee Weapon Attack: Str modifier + PB to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + Str modifier bludgeoning damage.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: {{tarling:str:mod}} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + {{tarling:str:mod}} bludgeoning.

description.p: Type: Active (action)

As an action, the tarling can spew a whip-like tongue of elastic tar at a creature no larger than itself that it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become grappled (escape DC equals save DC) by the tarling and be pulled up to 15 feet closer to the tarling. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, takes 9 (2d8) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns, and the tarling can’t use its bite attack against a different target. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn’t grappled, pulled, or restrained.
After the tarling uses this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a short or long rest.
When the tarling’s tamer reaches 9th level in the tamer class, the recurring damage of this action increases to 13 (3d8).

sheet.description: Range {{necrotar tonge:range}}ft. STR Save or grappled and pulled {{necrotar tonge:pull}} ft. Restrained, {{necrotar tongue:damage}} necrotic dmg at the start of each of its turns. Can't use bite (vs different target).

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)

When the tarling is targeted by a magic missile spell or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d4. On a 4, the tarling is unaffected and the energy is refracted into a random elemental type; a bolt of energy fires back at the caster as a ranged spell attack, using the caster’s spell attack modifier and dealing damage equal to the tarling’s current Hit Die size (see Growth improvements) on a hit. Roll another d4 to determine the damage type: 1-acid, 2-cold, 3-fire, 4-lightning.

sheet.description: When targeted by magic missile or ranged spell attack: d4. On a 4, unaffected, energy refracted, fires back at caster (caster's spell attack mod), damage = d{{hit dice size:tarling}}. Damage: d4 (1-acid, 2-cold, 3-fire, 4-lightning).

description.p: Type: Active (action)

As an action, the tarling can reanimate one corpse within 5 feet of it, merging its body with the corpse for the next hour. The corpse must have been a creature with a challenge rating equal to or lower than the tamer’s proficiency bonus and been of a size equal to or smaller than the tarling.

For the duration, the tarling gains the non-flying speeds of the corpse’s original creature and has two pools of hit points: its own and those from the corpse it inhabits. The corpse’s pool of hit points equals half the original creature’s hit point maximum. Whenever the tarling takes damage, half of the damage is transferred to the corpse and subtracted from that pool of hit points instead of the tarling’s. If the corpse’s pool of hit points is reduced to 0, the reanimation ends and the corpse is destroyed.
After the tarling uses this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a long rest.

sheet.description: Reanimate corpse (CR <= {{proficiency}}, size <= {{tarling:size}}). Gains corpse's non-flying speeds, two HP pools (tarling's and corpse's). Corpse HP = half original creature's max HP. Damage split between tarling and corpse. Ends when corpse HP = 0.

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)

The tarling’s size increases to Large, its Hit Die size increases to a d10 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage dice of its bite and tail attacks (see below), as well as its Arcane Activation, increase from a d8 to a d10. This growth improvement ignores the normal maximum companion size for a tamer.

sheet.description: Size: Large. Hit Die: d10. Bite/Tail/Arcane Activation damage: d10.

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)

The tarling’s size increases to Huge, its Hit Die size increases to a d12 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage dice of its bite and tail attacks (see below), as well as its Arcane Activation, increase from a d10 to a d12. This growth improvement ignores the normal maximum companion size for a tamer.

sheet.description: Size: Huge. Hit Die: d12. Bite/Tail/Arcane Activation damage: d12.

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)

The range of the tarling’s Necrotar Tongue action increases to 40 feet, it can pull the target up to 35 feet closer to it on a failed save, and the damage dealt to the grappled target increases to 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.
When the tarling’s tamer reaches 17th level in the tamer class, the recurring damage of this action increases to 22 (5d8).

sheet.description: Necrotar Tongue range: 40 ft, pull up to 35 ft, damage: 18 (4d8) necrotic.
Necrotar Tongue range: 40 ft, pull up to 35 ft, damage: 22 (5d8) necrotic.

description.p: Type: Active (bonus action)

As a bonus action, the tarling can grow to Gargantuan size for 1 minute. It gains a number of temporary hit points equal to its maximum number of Hit Dice, and the damage dice of its bite and tail attacks increase to 4d4. For the duration, the tarling deals double damage to structures and objects.

sheet.description: Size: Gargantuan (1 min). Gain THP = max Hit Dice. Bite/Tail damage: 4d4. Double damage to structures/objects.

description.p: Type: Passive (companion)
The tarling is immune to the charmed and frightened conditions.

sheet.description: Immune to charmed and frightened conditions.

description.p: Increase one existing speed by 15 feet up to a maximum of 150% of the creature’s base speed, rounded up to the nearest 5-foot increment.
E.g., a base speed of 30 feet can be increased to 45 feet maximum, a base speed of 25 feet can be increased to 40 feet, and a base speed of 20 feet to 30 feet.

sheet.description: Increase one existing speed by 15 feet (Max of 150%)

p.i: Your companion can’t gain proficiency in medium and heavy armour until it has gained proficiency in the prerequisite lighter armour types. For example, to gain proficiency in heavy armour, you must take this improvement 3 times: light, then medium, then heavy. Work with your GM to figure out if and how a creature can wield shields and weapons.
